description: Add an --override flag that completely bypasses loading the initial prompt.md file, allowing users who have fully customized their prompts to skip the default prompt loading. This flag must be mutually exclusive with all other flags to prevent conflicts.
steps: Add --override flag to the CLI argument parser in src/cli.ts:16 (after the 'sample' option)
Add --override as a boolean type option (no short form needed)
In src/main.ts, add validation logic after line 10 (after parseCliArgs()) to check if --override is used with other flags
If --override is combined with any other flag (help, version, max-iterations, sequential, message, file, sample), print an error message and exit with code 1
Modify the prompt loading logic in src/main.ts:62-75 to skip loading prompt.md entirely when --override is true
When --override is present, the prompt variable should only contain '@prd.json @progress.txt ' without loading the prompt.md file content
If prd.json already has content referencing an initial prompt, leave it as-is (don't modify the file, just don't use prompt.md in the current execution)
Add appropriate error message for invalid flag combinations: 'Error: --override cannot be used with other flags'
Test --override flag in isolation to verify it skips prompt loading correctly
Test --override with other flags (e.g., 'ralph --override -s') to verify mutual exclusivity error is shown
Ensure that all typecheck, test, and related lint npm scripts defined in package.json pass
